title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 November 2013 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki

09:50 <xwikibot> has quit  
09:54 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <vmassol> welcome back xwikibot! :)  
09:55 <cjd> 09:55 <@cjd> %later tell ircerr what is the % of messages that an IRC bot should drop in order to prevent bot chatter?  
10:01 <camil7> has left #xwiki  
10:08 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <vmassol> tmortagne: if I want to install a new version of a snapshot extension, I still need to remove the extension from the perm dir right?  
10:19 <vmassol> s/install/upgrade  
10:19 <vmassol> I'd like to test the upgrade too  
10:19 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <tmortagne> vmassol: EM will thing it's the same yes  
10:19 <tmortagne> think  
10:19 <vmassol> do I need to remove both the xar and the job status or just the xar dir?  
10:20 <tmortagne> no need to touch the status  
10:20 <tmortagne> it's just a log  
10:20 <vmassol> k  
10:24 <vmassol> tmortagne: when I upgraded I was expecting that deleted pages in the new version would be removed from my wiki but it didn"t happen  
10:24 <vmassol> is it because I didn't really do an upgrade?  
10:24 <vmassol> (since I had to remove the existing dir in the perm dir)  
10:25 <tmortagne> vmassol: if you remove the previous one EM can't does not know it  
10:25 <vmassol> so how can I test this?  
10:25 <tmortagne> s/does//  
10:25 <vmassol> (the upgrade)  
10:25 <tmortagne> change the version instead of removing it  
10:26 <vmassol> editing the xed file is enough?  
10:26 <tmortagne> yes  
10:26 <tmortagne> but you should also rename the file  
10:26 <tmortagne> since itherwise it will overwrite it  
10:26 <vmassol> ok  
10:26 <tmortagne> otherwise  
10:32 <vmassol> this is so dangerous….  
10:33 <vmassol> wait  
10:33 <vmassol> checking something  
10:33 <vmassol> it's ok :)  
10:34 <vmassol> grrrr  
10:34 <vmassol> I wanted to move all pages for the FAQ app into the FAQ space  
10:34 <vmassol> they're now in both the FAQ space and the FAQCode space  
10:35 <vmassol> the problem is that the FAQCode.FAQClass is now in FAQ.FAQClass thus all existing FAQ pages are broken....  
10:35 <vmassol> we often have this problem and it's painful, requires writing some migration  
10:36 <tmortagne> yep modifying a class is not easy  
10:37 <vmassol> so frist do we agree that now that we have hidden docs, it's better to have all the pages of an app in a single space?  
10:37 <vmassol> (rather then <XXX> and <XXXCode>)  
10:37 <tmortagne> donc know, I still don't like too much having data and code mixed  
10:37 <tmortagne> but the only good solution is subspaces  
10:37 <tmortagne> s/donc/don't/  
10:38 <vmassol> ok since it's too much work to write a migrator I'll leave it like this for now  
10:39 <tmortagne> problem when you have data and code in the same space is that you can have to make sure to not have collisions with page names and forbid in your UI some names  
10:39 <vmassol> rolling back all my changes  
10:39 <vmassol> sure but any good app will need to test if the page already exists or not  
10:40 <tmortagne> sure but you have a constraint on pages names that you would not have with separated spaces  
10:40 <tmortagne> especially when you have lots of code  
10:42 <vmassol> yes but even with a separation you still need to have tech code in the data space  
10:42 <vmassol> like FAQ.WebHome  
10:42 <vmassol> FAQ.Search  
10:42 <sburjan`> has quit  
10:42 <vmassol> that will be needed even with nested spaces btw  
10:44 <tmortagne> not really no, you would put datas in a subspaces  
10:44 <tmortagne> and only data  
10:44 <vmassol> indeed  
10:45 <vmassol> good point  
10:47 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <sburjan> cjd: hello. Have you ever used WOL on Linux ?  
10:50 <tmortagne> World of Logs ? :)  
10:51 <vmassol> ?  
10:52 <sburjan> wake up on LAN :)  
10:52 <tmortagne> isn't it supposed to be manager by the bios ?  
10:52 <tmortagne> I don't see how this could be related with the OS which is sleeping by definition  
10:53 <sburjan> tmortagne: yes, but I see that on WIndows you have to make certain settings to the NIC like "Allow the network card to wake the system"  
10:53 <cjd> nope  
10:53 <vmassol> ;)  
10:53 <cjd> I tend not to use suspend/hibernate because it's a hardware compat disaster  
10:53 <cjd> everybody builds a laptop, tests with windows and ships  
10:54 <cjd> and ofc mac has only 1 piece of hardware to support  
10:54 <cjd> it would be nice if ubuntu sold laptops  
10:55 <tmortagne> Dell sell laptops with ubuntu  
10:55 <cjd> yeah, those might be good  
11:00 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <vmassol> has quit  
11:18 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:18 <vmassol1> mflorea: did you see my message earlier about the release?  
11:19 <vmassol1> (or maybe I missed your answer ? :)  
11:19 <vmassol1> )  
11:19 <mflorea> seen it, but my answer is http://ci.xwiki.org/  
11:19 <vmassol1> sure but that wasn't my question :)  
11:20 <vmassol1> if BFD code goes on master, it's likely that it'll take longer to stabiize master with important risks of M2 having issue  
11:20 <vmassol1> it'"s a general problem we have when we release close to BFD  
11:21 <vmassol1> I don't have the answer though except to not release after Thursay  
11:21 <mflorea> you're not telling me any news :)  
11:21 <vmassol1> the news is that it's bad idea to plan a releaseon Thursday or Firday  
11:21 <vmassol1> IMO  
11:21 <mflorea> but GD ask for more days and the earlies was today  
11:22 <vmassol1> we'll see but I highliy doubt it's going to happen today  
11:22 <vmassol1> anyway we can ask committers to be careful about their commits today  
11:22 <vmassol1> ;)  
11:22 <vmassol1> nothing dangerous please  
11:22 <vmassol1> :)  
11:23 <mflorea> well, if I had put the release on next Monday we will actually be doing it Tuesday or Wednesday. My idea was to put some pressure and prepare the release asap  
11:24 <vmassol1> yes  
11:24 <vmassol1> that's good  
11:24 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
11:25 <mflorea> I'd like to release tomorrow early morning. I'll spend some time in the afternoon to check the failing jobs  
11:37 <vmassol> mflorea: are you looking into http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9654# ? If not I can give it a try this afternoon  
11:37 <mflorea> vmassol: I'm not, go ahead  
11:38 <vmassol> ok  
11:39 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: shouldn't http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9553 be applied to 5.2.2?  
11:40 <vmassol> s/5.2.2/5.2.2 too/  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: then the commit would be different  
11:40 <vmassol> I see you've just added:  
11:40 <vmassol>  && $xwiki.exists($contributor)  
11:41 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: the modified page are not in the same module in 5.2 and in 5.3  
11:41 <gdelhumeau> but I can do it, yes :)  
11:41 <vmassol> ok  
11:41 <vmassol> no that's ok  
11:41 <vmassol> it's not a major issue  
11:41 <vmassol> if it was easy it would have been nice  
11:41 <vmassol> forget it, was jsut checking  
11:55 <gdelhumeau> We don't have a method to test if a user is a member of a group ?  
11:56 <gdelhumeau> something like "boolean memberOf(member, group)"  
11:58 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: we have all sort of methods like this in rightmanager plugin but it's not multiwiki  
11:58 <tmortagne> $xwiki.rightsmanager  
11:59 <gdelhumeau> where should I write it, for multiwiki  
11:59 <gdelhumeau> ?  
11:59 <tmortagne> and since it's a plugin it's script oriented  
12:00 <tmortagne> should be in a new user module which has been pushed back for a long time  
12:02 <gdelhumeau> because I have written a piece of code that I'm putting in WikiUserManager#isMember(), but it could be more generic  
12:11 <evalica> gdelhumeau: hi - I don't know if you know, but I've downloaded the latest snapshot and the wiki doesn't start - it shows "java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/xwiki/wiki/WikiDescriptorException  
12:16 <gdelhumeau> my local build works, but I guess there is an issue with the build on jenkies  
12:21 <evalica> has quit  
12:21 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
12:21 <evalica1> is now known as <evalica>  
12:29 <chalx> has quit  
12:57 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
13:00 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
13:06 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
13:06 <jtafurth|away> is now known as <jtafurth>  
13:16 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
13:28 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: I am looking at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9553. Is 5.3 the correct fixFor version ? I am asking this because 5.3 M2 is still to be released  
13:34 <mflorea> has quit  
13:54 <j-simard> has quit  
13:55 <cjd> vmassol: 13:53 <@ircerr> i'd say 5% for a good anti-self flood. 1% would break recursion tho <-- how to prevent endless bot chatter from an authority on IRC  
13:58 <vmassol> cjd: maybe you could file a jira issue for the IRC bot feature explaining what needs to be done? :)  
13:58 <vmassol> (thanks)  
13:58 <cjd> can do  
13:58 <cjd> it's like a 1 line patch  
13:58 <cjd> but it's nice to have a jira to point to so people understand why it's intentionally misbehaving 1/100 times  
14:11 <gdelhumeau> sburjan: thx for having noticed it, tmortagne has made the change  
14:21 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
14:21 <vmassol> has quit  
14:26 <jtafurth> is now known as <jtafurth|away>  
14:26 <jtafurth|away> is now known as <jtafurth>  
14:29 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: another issue http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9364  
14:30 <gdelhumeau> yep, I think I will close it at the same time than XWIKI-9516  
14:34 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9491  
14:34 <gdelhumeau> same  
14:34 <sburjan> you should put fixFor the next version which is due to be released  
14:34 <sburjan> no for the final version  
14:35 <sburjan> it can cause to confusion if there is a regression. It makes harder for the developer to fgure out  
14:36 <gdelhumeau> I change this  
14:36 <sburjan> there are others: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9558  
14:37 <gdelhumeau> it was because Silvia asked me to set the fixFor just after our meeting, and I was not able to know if it will be the M2 or the RC1 at that time  
14:38 <sburjan> I understand. But it's not a good idea IMO to set 5.3 final  
14:38 <sburjan> and why wouldn't there be a M2 or RC1 ?  
14:39 <sburjan> also this: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9554  
14:39 <sburjan> we must keep JIRA in order and accurate  
14:40 <jtafurth> is now known as <jtafurth|away>  
14:43 <cjd> nice  
14:44 <vmassol1> cjd: wait for the email  
14:44 <vmassol1> :)  
14:45 <vmassol1> coming in a few minutes  
14:46 <vmassol1> cool  
14:46 <cjd> I'll do that in the txt editor so I don't hold the lock forevar  
14:57 <chalx> has quit  
14:59 <vmassol1> mail sent!  
15:16 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <vmassol> should be up now  
15:17 <vmassol> cjd: hope your story wasn't lost :)  
15:17 <vmassol> (it's not showing on the page)  
15:20 <cjd> nah, it's in my editor because I didn't want to hold the lock on the page forever  
15:20 <vmassol> k  
15:23 <cjd> </XWiki SAS hat> <-- spaces are not allowed in XML, better make that   "XWiki SAS hat": { "json" }  
15:23 <cjd> :)  
15:26 <evalica> has quit  
15:26 <vmassol> ahah  
15:34 <vmassol> cjd: :)  
15:34 <cjd> I realized last night that I can wire my allocator to check for dangling pointers during free operations and blow up if there is one  
15:35 <cjd> it just requires a little bit of C preprocessing  
15:35 <cjd> <off-topic  
15:35 <cjd> >  
15:35 <cjd> newlines in an XML tag, that should be good

17:02 <sdumitriu> Nope  
17:03 <Denis> neither

17:31 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
17:36 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
17:38 <chalx> has quit  
17:58 <mflorea> tmortagne, gdelhumeau: can you move your jira issues to 5.3RC1 please? Thanks.  
17:59 <gdelhumeau> are you going to do the release ?
